label: A rdfs:label
definition: AL definition@en SPLIT=|

label: clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer.

label: clinical history devoid of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there was no diagnosis of cancer.

label: unknown clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which it is not known whether there was a diagnosis of cancer.

label: diagnosis of cancer
definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has cancer.

label: family clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a blood relative.

label: aunt clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in the female sibling of a parent.

label: brother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling.

label: daughter clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's female child.

label: father clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent.

label: mother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent.

label: sister clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female sibling.

label: son clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's male child.

label: uncle clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling of a parent.

label: grandmother clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent of a parent.

label: grandfather clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent of a parent.

label: nephew clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male child of a sibling.

label: niece clinical history of cancer
definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female child of a sibling.

label: diagnosis of infectious disease
definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has an infectious disease.

label: diagnosis of hepatitis B
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus.

label: diagnosis of hepatitis C
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus.

label: diagnosis of HIV
definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2).

label: clinical history of repeated HIV assays
definition: A clinical history in which there is repeated reactive screening assays for human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2) antibodies regardless of the results of supplemental assays.

label: exposure to second hand smoke
definition: A clinical history in which there has been second hand exposure to tobacco smoking.

label: exposure to second hand smoke in household during childhood
definition: An exposure to second hand smoke that occurred in the (patient's) household when the person was a child.

label: exposure to second hand smoke in current household
definition: An exposure to second hand smoke in person's current household.

label: pregnancy history
definition: A clinical history in which a female has had a pregnancy.

label: number of pregnancies
definition: A measurement datum of the total number of pregnancies a woman has had.

label: number of live births
definition: A measurement datum of the total number of live births a female has had.

label: age when gave birth to first child
definition: An age measurement datum performed on a female when her first biological child was born.

label: gynecologic surgery history
definition: A clinical history in which a woman has had gynecologic surgery in the past.

label: hysterectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a hysterectomy.

label: unilateral oophorectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a unilateral oophorectomy.

label: neither hysterectomy nor oophorectomy history
definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has not had either a hysterectomy or an oophorectomy.

label: hormonal birth control use history
definition: An information content entity that indicates whether a woman has ever used oral contraceptives in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy.

label: hormonal birth control former use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has previously been a hormonal birth control user but is not a current user.

label: hormonal birth control current use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual is currently a hormonal birth control user.

label: no hormonal birth control use history
definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has not ever been a hormonal birth control user.

label: hormonal replacement therapy history
definition: A clinical history in which an individual has had hormonal replacement therapy in the past.

label: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A processed material used for delivery of hormones in hormone replacement therapy.

label: pill delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a pill for oral administration.
parent class: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

label: patch delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a patch for transdermal administration.
parent class: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

label: cream delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy
definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a cream for transdermal administration.
parent class: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

label: menopausal status
definition: An information content entity that indicates the state of a female's cessation of menstruation.

label: indeterminate menopausal status
definition: A menopausal status that is neither pre- nor post-menopausal.

label: premenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that less than 6 months has passed since the last menstrual period and there has not been prior bilateral oophorectomy and not on estrogen replacement.

label: perimenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been 6-12 months since last menstrual period.

label: postmenopausal status
definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been more than 12 months since the last menstrual period with no prior hysterectomy or that there has been a prior bilateral oophorectomy.

label: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history
definition: An information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.

label: exposure to arsenic history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is arsenic.
parent class: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

label: exposure to asbestos history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is asbestos.
parent class: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

label: exposure to diesel exhaust history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is diesel exhaust.
parent class: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

label: exposure to chromium history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is chromium.
parent class: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

label: exposure to silica history
definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is silica.
parent class: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

label: indicator of whether an inclusion criterion was met
definition: An information content entity that indicates whether or not  an entity has met a specific requirement in order to take part in a given process.

label: indicator of whether all inclusion criteria were met
definition: An information content entity  that indicates whether or not  an entity  has met all specific requirements in order to take part in a given process.

label: age of majority inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: chemotherapy treatment exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

label: radiation treatment exclusion criteria
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process

label: chemotherapy treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: An exclusion criterion defined by the pathologist is defined as whether the individual received chemotherapy within the last two years.

label: radiation treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: An exclusion criterion defined by the pathologist is defined as whether the individual received  radiation therapy within the last two years.

label: BMI range inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a Body Mass Index range, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: An important inclusion criterion is for for the individual to have a BMI between 18.5 and 35.0

label: blood transfusion exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion that is defined by whether the specimen donor received a whole blood transfusion within a specified time frame prior to death, which if met, makes a specimen donor unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: An exclusion criterion that is defined by whether the specimen donor received a whole blood transfusion within 48 hours prior to death.

label: history of metastatic cancer exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined as whether an individual has ever been diagnosed with metastatic cancer (cancer that spread beyond the initial site such as to other organs like brain bone or liver), which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: intravenous drug use exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined as when an individual has a history of intravenous drug abuse for a specific timeframe, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: Donor eligibility based on history of intravenous drug abuse in the last 5 years.

label: history of sex with someone with a history of blood borne infection  exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for a blood borne infections disease in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: Donor eligibility based on whether the donor has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for HIV/AIDS and/or HCV and/or HBV in the last 5 years.

label: history of sex with someone with a history of intravenous drugs exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: Donor eligibility based on whether the donor has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in the last 5 years.

label: HIV exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of repeatedly reactive screening assays for HIV-1 or HIV-2 antibody regardless of the results of supplemental assays, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

label: exposure to blood borne infectious disease exclusion criterion
definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has been exposed to a blood borne infections disease through needle sticks and/or contact with non-intact skin and/or contact with open wounds and/or contact with mucous membranes, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
example of usage: Donor eligibility based on whether the donor has been exposed to HIV/AIDS.
